heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The 5th ranked rain rate was recorded today with a peak rate of 11.8mm per hour, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  7.28mm of rain fell during the storm's 1.8 hours length.  On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: When lightning struck on 13 May 2025, its position was recorded at just 4.97 miles away, the closest on record.

storm.status: Stormy conditions are expected.  This is the first storm in the region since 07 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average wind direction is southerly (196°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 15%) and rainfall (up 9.1 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1304 m), feels like temperature (up 4.3°C), outside temperature (up 3.0°C), and rainfall (down 9.2 mm) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 1195.7m lower than yesterday, 1052.7m lower than the past week, 1304.1m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 911m and a peak of 4090m, averaging 1080.0m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; mild and pleasant. Also, pleasant humidity levels and little or no wind. Some rain can be expected, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and it’s dim outside. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.
